text: Charlotte Georgina Trower (born 1855, Ware, Hertfordshire, d. 8 November 1928, Ware, Hertfordshire) was a British botanical illustrator and botanist noted for her watercolor paintings of mostly British plants and flowers. She collaborated with her sister Alice and amateur botanist George Claridge Druce to create over 1,800 scientifically accurate paintings. Her illustrations were used as major contributions in two books, Skene's Flower Book for the Pocket and British Brambles. == Works == * * * == References == Category:1855 births Category:1928 deaths Category:Botanical illustrators Category:19th-century British botanists Category:20th-century British botanists Category:British women botanists Category:British women illustrators Category:19th-century British painters Category:19th-century British women artists Category:20th- century British painters Category:20th-century British women artists Category:19th-century British women scientists Category:20th-century British women scientists Category:People from Ware, Hertfordshire
